name: Sass
description: Sass is the most mature, stable, and powerful professional grade CSS extension language in the world.

name: Compass
description: Compass is an open-source CSS authoring framework which uses the Sass stylesheet language to make writing stylesheets powerful and easy. If you're not familiar with Sass, Go to sass-lang.com to learn all about how it works.

name: The Sassway
description: The Sass Way covers the latest news and topics on handcrafting CSS with Sass and Compass. We use an open publishing model and rely on contributions from the Sass community via our GitHub project.

name: Bourbon
description: A simple and lightweight mixin library for Sass

name: Susy
description: In a world of agile development and super-tablet-multi-magic-laptop-phones, the best layouts can‚Äôt be contained in a single framework or technique. CSS Libraries are a bloated mess of opinions about how to do your job. Why let the table-saw tell you where to put the kitchen?

name: Modular Scale
description: Sassy Modular Scale is a Sass-based mixin that calculates the incremental values of the modular scale in proportion to a set size and ratio. It was inspired by and adapted from Tim Brown's Modular Scale, and can be used as a Compass Extension or installed as a Ruby gem. Included are functions for a number of classic design and musical scale ratios, with the ability to add your own ratios, as well.

name: Bootstrap Sass
description: Bootstrap Sass is a Sass-powered version of Twitter's Bootstrap, ready to drop right into your Sass-powered projects. Installation is straightforward: Set up your Ruby On Rails installation, import Bootstrap in an SCSS file to get of all Bootstrap's styles, mixins and variables, then include Bootstrap's JavaScript files.

name: Sass Guidelines
description: An opinionated styleguide for writing sane, maintainable and scalable Sass by Hugo Giraudel.

name: SassDoc
description: SassDoc is to Sass what JSDoc is to JavaScript: a documentation system to build pretty and powerful docs in the blink of an eye. Among other things, SassDoc is: usable out of the box; highly customisable; blazingly fast; fully themable; integrated with Grunt/Gulp/Broccoli or directly Node.

name: Hugo Giraudel
description: CSS goblin. Sass hacker. Margin psycho. Author of Sass Guidelines, SassDoc, Sass Compatibility, Browserhacks and a lot of Sass stuff.

name: Sass Reference
description: An attempt at making Sass more approachable by providing short yet insightful entries for all buzzwords.

name: Sass Bites Podcast
description: A weekly bite of Sass during your lunch break..

name: SassMeister
description: SassMeister is a playground for Sass, Compass, and LibSass. Add some Sass and SassMeister will show you the rendered CSS. SassMeister supports both Sass and SCSS syntaxes, all output styles, and an ever-expanding list of Compass extensions and Sass libraries.

name: Sass News
description: Sass News is a weekly newsletter edited, curated and published by Jina Anne (formerly by Stu Robson)

name: Sassdash
description: Sassdash is lodash for Sass -- the largest collection of well-tested utility functions for maps, lists, strings, numbers, and more. Works with both node-sass (LibSass) and Ruby Sass, with no extra dependencies.

name: scss-lint
description: Configurable tool for writing clean and consistent SCSS.

name: vary
description: Sass theming made easy. The vary mixin is the most flexible, scalable and modular Sass theming solution out there.

name: Frame Based Animation
description: A Sass @mixin for creating traditional frame-based animations, especially with SVG. Think gifs, but scalable and with more control over combining animations together.

name: Outline
description: The clean & simple responsive framework. It's a modular, mobile-first framework which includes todays best practices for responsive design and core components I use on every project. Outline is designed to be a starting point. A solid foundation for your project, leaving the creativity up to you.

name: sassy-validation
description: Sass data type validation library. Sassy-validation is a handy addition for every Sass project which uses @functions and/or @mixins.

name: Rebar Grid Framework
description: Rebar is a Sass / Stylus grid framework that makes responsive development more efficient and keeps CSS organised.

name: Scally
description: Scally is a Sass-based, BEM, OOCSS, responsive ready, CSS framework that provides you with a solid foundation for building reusable UI's quickly.

name: Better CSS with Sass
description: A book by Cole Henley. CSS has the dual benefit of being incredibly powerful but also very easy to learn. However, it is an incredibly forgiving and lazy language which can hide a multitude of sins. Writing good, efficient CSS can be complicated but fortunately Sass can help us out.

name: Learning Sass with CodePen Series
description: Mr. Dudley Storey has been blogging a series about learning Sass and making CodePen demos for the concepts along the way. It's a great way to get acquainted with the CSS preprocessor if you haven't yet. Seven parts so far!

name: Sassy Sass
description: Sassy Sass is a scaffolding tool to help you organize your project‚Äôs Sass structure. With a simple command, add a well-structured architecture for your project's CSS. Based off the SMACSS methodology, SassySass creates a simple, maintainable structure for your Sass files.

name: sassy-exists
description: Sass micro library for existence checks. Handy addition for every Sass project which can't afford to have any doubts.

name: sass-mq
description: Media Queries with superpowers. mq() is a Sass mixin that helps you compose media queries in an elegant way.

name: sass-maps-plus
description: Advanced map and list-map functions for all versions of Sass. They provide advanced native map data-type manipulation and inspection in libsass (as of version 3.1) and ruby-sass (as of version 3.3).

name: include-media
description: Simple, elegant and maintainable media queries in Sass

name: sass-boilerplate
description: A boilerplate for Sass projects using the 7-1 architecture pattern by Hugo Giraudel.

name: Sass MediaQueries
description: It's a collection of useful Media Queries mixins for Sass (including iOS devices, TVs and more). Fully customizable and very easy to use.

name: SystemJS Sass plugin
description: A Sass loader plugin for SystemJS, based on sass.js. This plugin allows importing SCSS files from SystemJS and have them dynamically compiled to CSS and loaded into the page from within the browser. Alternatively, the SCSS files can also be converted to CSS statically by creating bundles with JSPM.

name: AcceCSS
description: A Sass mixin that debugs & checks the accessibility of your designs. This mixin will allow you to get an overview of all the zones of your layout, get a grascaled version to check the contrast, as well as 8 different filters to emulate the most common coloblindness types.

name: Sassaby
description: Sassaby is a unit testing library for SASS mixins and functions. It is written in Node to provide a consistent interface with other front-end tests in your system and for easy integration into a build system. Its interface can be used with any Node testing library (Mocha, Jasmine, etc.).

name: css2sass
description: Convert CSS Snippets to Syntactically Awesome StyleSheets code.

name: PreCSS
description: PreCSS is a tool that allows you to use Sass-like markup in your CSS files. Enjoy a familiar syntax with variables, mixins, conditionals, and other goodies.

name: Sass Colour Function Calculator
description: A tool for calculating the Sass colour function required to get from one colour to another.

name: Sass Director
description: What Sass Director does is enable a developer to architect an entire project structure within a single manifest file. During the initial setup, instead of manually creating all of the directories and files within them, the outputted shell commands will do the job quickly.

name: Sassport
description: JavaScript modules for Sass (node-sass). Easily share assets, and JavaScript functions and values in your Sass projects.

name: Gridle{.scss}
description: Because each grid system out there have cool features, but none of them includes all. This is why Gridle is all about...

name: Zurb Motion UI
description: A Sass library for creating flexible CSS transitions and animations.

name: SassBlocks
description: SassBlocks introduces a pattern to make working with bem-blocks/modules in Sass/Scss a little more oop.

name: Neutron CSS
description: A Sass framework that empowers you to create flexible, clear, and semantic website layouts.

name: Takana
description: Takana is a Sass/CSS live-editor. It lets you see your SCSS and CSS style changes live, in the browser, as you type them.

name: Avalanche
description: Superclean, powerful, responsive, Sass-based, BEM-syntax CSS grid system

name: Sierra
description: Superclean, powerful, responsive, Sass-based, BEM-syntax CSS grid system

name: Aurora Grid
description: Easy, flexible and full of responsive and mobile first features, made for designers, CSS Grid System.

name: Buttons
description: A highly customizable production ready mobile web and desktop css button library. Buttons is free and open source.

name: Typesettings
description: A Sass or Stylus toolkit that sets type in Ems based on modular scale, vertical rhythm, and responsive ratio based headlines.

name: Scut
description: A collection of Sass utilities to ease and improve our implementations of common style-code patterns.

name: Sassmatic
description: A photo filter library using Sass and Compass.

name: Saffron
description: A simple Sass mixin library for animations and transitions.

name: Sassline
description: Set text on the web to a baseline grid with Sass & rems using a responsive modular-scale.

name: Sunglass
description: A mixin and functions library for Sass

name: Typi
description: A sass mixin to make responsive typography easy

name: Mappy Breakpoints
description: A Breakpoint Mixin that uses Sass Maps

name: SassyTester
description: A minimalistic function tester in Sass.

name: sass-gulp-svg-sprite
description: Creating SVG Sprites using Gulp and Sass.

name: fromSassToPostCSS
description: A gulpfile to take the plunge from Sass to PostCSS.

name: Sassquatch
description: Zero-Setup Sass Previewer for OS X.

name: sass-lint
description: A Node-only Sass linter for both sass and scss syntax!

name: grunt-sassyclean
description: Sassy Clean scans a project for partials that are never imported.

name: Family.scss
description: A set of 20 smart Sass mixins which will help you to manage the style of :nth-child'ified elements, in an easy and classy way.

name: Top 10 scss mixins
description: 10 Sass (SCSS) mixins you should be using in your projects

name: Angled Edges üìê
description: A Sass mixin for creating angled edges on sections by dynamically encoding SVGs.

name: css2scss
description: This converter takes (valid) CSS and generates compass (scss) code, SASS or cleaned css for it.

name: Sass Burger
description: A Sass mixin for creating hamburger icons. 100% vegan.

name: Sassy-Gridlover
description: Super easy to use Sass mixins to establish a typographic system with modular scale and vertical rhythm. Based on the Gridlover app.

name: mini.css
description: A minimal Sass-y responsive mobile-first style-agnostic CSS framework.

name: Sprite Spirit
description: SCSS Mixin that Brings Image Sprite to life.

name: Sass Magic
description: A collection of Sass mixins and functions to improve our implementations of style-code patterns.

name: mq-scss
description: An extreamly powerful but easy to use Sass media query mixin.

name: font-face-generator
description: An @font-face code generator for SCSS.

name: Sass Debugger
description: This scss file provides a way to debug your project with a visual highlight style preview based in some options that you can customize.
